summary: TWO YEAR OLD TIRES (ALL 4, PURCHASED AT SAME TIME) HAVE CIRCUMFERENTIAL CRACKS IN TREAD GROOVES - TIRE SELLER SAYS THESE ARE VERY ABNORMAL AND IS REPLACING ALL OF THEM.  HAVE ONLY 20,000 MILES OF WEAR ON TIRES RATED FOR 80,000.  NO CATASTROPHIC FAILURES.   TIRES A GOODRICH TRACTION T/A 195/60R15 88H.  DOT CODE ON ALL 4 TIRES: ANRBMC112705.  *TR

DT*:  THE CONTACT STATED THERE WAS A RECALL ON THE VEHICLE, NHTSA #94V052000 CONCERNING THE MANUAL TRANSMISSION.  THE RECALL WORK WAS PERFORMED PRIOR TO PURCHASE.  THE TRANSMISSION LOCKED UP WHILE DRIVING 25 MPH.  THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO AN INDEPENDENT REPAIR SHOP, BUT HAS NOT BEEN INSPECTED.

DT: THE CONTACT STATED THE SHOULDER HARNESS ON BOTH FRONT SEAT BELTS DID NOT PROVIDE ADEQUATE RESTRAINT WHEN IN USE.  THE STRAPS GAVE  WAY WHEN PROPERLY BUCKLED.  THE SEAT BELTS WERE NOT COVERED UNDER WARRANTY.  HE PURCHASED REPLACEMENT STRAPS AND PLANNED  TO REPLACE THE STRAPS HIMSELF.  *AK

THE CONSUMER PURCHASED FOUR NEW FIRESTONE TIRES. THE RIGHT REAR TIRE WENT FLAT. THE VEHICLE WAS PARKED. THE CORD THAT MEETS THE RIM OF THE WHEEL SEPARATED FROM THE TIRE. CONTACTED THE MANUFACTURER WAS TOLD SHE COULD PURCHASE ANOTHER TIRE FOR HALF PRICE. PLEASE PROVIDE ANY FURTHER INFORMATION.  *JB

DEAR SIR/MADAM:  THANKS FOR HELP.  IT IS THREATEN TO THOUSANDS SUBARU CAR DRIVERS, LIKE FIRESTONE TIRES THREATEN TO THOUSANDS CAR     DRIVERS USING FIRESTONE TIRES.  I HAVE A 93 4D LEGACY SEDAN, IT HAVE A PROBLEM SINCE 1994 AND BECOME VERY BAD SINCE 7/2000, SOME     TIME CAR UNCONTROLLABLE TO SLOWDOWN TO 10 TO 20 MPH AND SOME TIME ENGINE STOPPED, PUT ME IN VERY     DANGEROUS SITUATION: MY CAR UNCONTROLLABLE STOPPED WHEN OTHER CARS DRIVE 65+ MILES ON FREE WAY OR     45+ MILES ON LOCAL ROAD.  I THINK THIS A CONTROLLER DESIGN PROBLEM, IT SHOULD NOT SLOW DOWN AND STOP ENGINE WITHOUT WARNING     LIGHT FIRST AND SHOULD NEVER STOP ENGINE. IF YOU SEARCH INTERNET WITH KEY WORD "+SUBARU +LEGACY     +HESITATION" YOU CAN SEE MANY COMPLAINTS ABOUT THE MALFUNCTIONED CONTROLLER.  I STILL THINK SUBARU HAVE FOLLOWING OBLIGATIONS:  THANKS   ZHONGMIN SUN  18666 REDMOND WAY, RR2141  REDMOND, WA 98052  TEL:4258369419  EMAIL: ZHONGMINSUN@MSN.COM

FUEL FILLER PIPE HAD ALL KINDS OF DIRT, DEBRIS AND RUST CAUSING IT TO FAIL AND LEAK OIL.  THE FILER TUBE RUSTED AND CAUSED FUEL TO LEAK FROM THE VEHICLE.  WHEN THE CONSUMER PULLED THE PLASTIC SHROUD AWAY FROM THE FILLER PIPE HE NOTICED ALL KINDS OF ROAD DIRT, RUST AND DEBRIS HAD ACCUMULATED AND CAUSED THE PIPE TO FAIL.  THE CONSUMER ALSO HAS A 1995 LEGACY L/L AND IS CONCERNED THAT THE FAILURE MAY OCCUR IN THAT VEHICLE.  THE CONSUMER REQUESTED REIMBURSEMENT.  *NLM
CONSUMER NOTICED THE FRONT SEAT BELTS DOESN'T COME UP PROPERLY, DEALER REPLACED THE BELT THREE TIMES AND THE PROBLEM STILL REOCCURING.  NLM
CONSUMER STATES THAT THE DRIVER SIDE FRONT DOOR HAS  DEFECTIVE LOCKS, THE LOCKS WILL INTERMITTENLY LOCK.  CONTACTED DEALER AND THE DEALER IS NOT WILLING TO DO ANYTHING.  NLM

CONSUMER STATED THAT ON JULY 1,2000, THERE WAS A BLOWOUT OF THE GOOD YEAR EAGLE GA TIRES, PRODUCT CODE 113-938-444-0, DOT #MKJ6FJOR206 AND MKJ6FJOR393, WHILE DRIVING, AT THAT TIME IT WAS 88,000 MILES ON THE CAR, ON NOVEMBER 6, 2000, THE SECOND BLOWOUT OCCURED ON A BUSY FREEWAY, AT THAT TIME IT WAS 93,837 MILES ON THE CAR. ON SEPTEMBER 11, 2001, THE THIRD BLOWOUT OCCURED ON A BUSY FREEWAY AT THAT TIME IT WAS 103,214 MILES ON THE CAR.  AT CONSUMERS REQUEST, THE DEALER EXAMINED THE BLOWN OUT TIRES, HE DETERMINED THAT BOTH THE BLOWN TIRES AND THE REMAINING TIRE ON THE CAR THAT WAS PURCHASED WERE EXPERIENCING BELT EDGE SEPARATION.  DEALER REMOVED THE TIRES AND GAVE TREAD LIFE CREDIT FOR THE BLOWN TIRE AND TWO TIRES THEY REMOVED FROM THE CAR.  CONSUMER STATING THAT ALL FOUR TIRES WERE DEFECTIVE.  *YD

THE CLUTCH ON THIS VEHICLE HAS FAILED THREE (3) TIMES.  IT WAS REPLACED BY THE DEALER IN 1995, REPLACED AGAIN IN 1999 AND HAS FAILED A THIRD TIME IN DECEMBER 2001.  THE FAILURE OF THE CLUTCH IS A SEVERE SAFETY HAZARD AS THE DRIVER SUDDENLY FINDS THE VEHICLE CAN'T MOVE.  ALL OF THE REPLACEMENTS HAVE BEEN PERFORMED BY THE ORIGINAL DEALER USING SUBARU ORIGINAL PARTS.*AK

SOON AFTER PURCHASE, HEADLIGHT LENSES STARTED BECOMING OPAQUE/FOGGED IN APPEARANCE.  THE HEADLIGHTS OF MY GIRLFRIEND'S '92 SUBARU LEGACY LOOKED THE SAME.  NEVER THOUGHT MUCH ABOUT IT  BECAUSE I LIVED IN A LARGE URBAN AREA WITH WELL LIT STREETS.  WAS RECENTLY TRANSFERRED TO THE LITTLE CITY OF SAVANNAH, GA.  NOTICED THAT IT IS HARD TO SEE AT NIGHT.  LAST NIGHT SOMEONE INFORMED ME THAT I SHOULD REPLACE  MY HEADLIGHTS BECAUSE THEY ARE BARELY VISIBLE.  I LOOKED AT THEM AND THEY ARE EXTREMELY DIM.  CALLED THE NEAREST DEALER AND THE PARTS MANAGER SAID THAT THIS IS A VERY COMMON PROBLEM CAUSED BY THE CHEAP PLASTIC USED TO MAKE THE LENS FOR THE HEADLIGHT ASSEMBLY.  IT IS A LITTLE LATE TO BE REPORTING IT, BUT THIS SEEMS TO BE A DEFINITE SAFETY HAZARD.  WAS THERE EVER A RECALL FOR THESE HEADLIGHTS?*AK
BOTH FRONT SEAT MOTERIZED SEAT BELT RESTRAINTS FAILED. THE CABLE ON BOTH SIDES CAME OUT.*AK

DRIVING ON HIGHWAY AT APPROXIMATELY 65MHP WHEN BELTS BEGAN TO MAKE NOISE. SHORTLY FOLLOWING CAR LOSS POWER, INCLUDING STEERING. IT WAS REPORTED BY A MECHANIC THAT THE CRANKSHAFT PULLEY HAD COME LOOSE AND THE CRANKSHAFT HAD BEEN DAMAGED BEYOND REPAIR. CAR WILL NEED SMALL BLOCK OVERHAUL OR REPLACEMENT ENGINE TO FUNCTION AGAIN.

5 MINUTES AFTER PARKING VEHICLE, IGNITION TURNED OFF CONSUMER NOTICED SMOKE ON INSIDE OF VEHICLE. FIRE DEPARTMENT PUT OUT FIRE. VEHICLE NOT TAKEN TO DEALER AMOUNT OF DAMAGE UNKNOWN. CONSUMER STATED  THA TFIRE CAUSED BY AUTOMATIC TRACK  SEAT BELT MOTOR. PASSENGER DOOR PANEL, SEAT AND HEAD REST WERE  MELTED. PLEASE ADD FURTHER COMMENTS.*AK

VEHICLE KEPT STALLING OUT AND WOULD NOT RESTART FOR AT LEAST 30 MINUTES.  VEHICLE HAS BEEN TAKEN TO DEALER TWICE.  BUT, COULD NOT DETERMINE CAUSE. CONSUMER FEELS IT IS AN ELECTRICAL PROBLEM.  *AK   *SLC
WHILE DRIVING, THE ENGINE STALLED, CAUSING A LOSS OF POWER STEERING, CONSUMER COASTED VEHICLE TO A STOP AND IT IMMEDIATELY RESTARTED.   *SLC
THREATEN TO THOUSANDS SUBARU CAR DRIVERS, LIKE FIRESTONE TIRES THREATEN TO THOUSANDS CAR DRIVERS USING FIRESTONE TIRES.

VEHICLE IS SOMETIMES UNCONTROLLABLE TO SLOWDOWN AT 10 TO 20 MPH AND ENGINE STOPS WHILE OTHER VEHICLES ARE DRIVING 65 MPH, VEHICLE STALLS INTERMITTENTLY WITHOUT WARNING, DUE TO MALFUNCTIONED CONTROLLER. *ET
CONSUMER WAS TRAVELING ABOUT 15MPH ON  HIGHWAY AND DRIVER'S SIDE FRONT WINDOW JUST EXPLODED.   DEALERSHIP WILL BE NOTIFIED.  *AK
TREAD SEPARATION, 2ND TIRE REPLACED FOR THIS REASON.  *AK( DOT NUMBER:   TIRE SIZE: P195/60R15 )

WHILE DRIVING ABOUT 70 MPH  VEHICLE STARTED VIBRATING. THEN PULLED OFF THE ROAD, AND FOUND OUT THAT TREAD SEPARATED.  FIRESTONE F570.  *AK  THE TIRE TREAD WAS FOUND DANGLING FROM THE AXLE. AFTER THIS INCIDENT, ANOTHER TIRE PEELED OFF THE STEEL LAYERS UNDERNEATH AND WAS REPLACED.  *YH

THE ENGINE CUTS OFF WHILE GOING DOWN THE ROAD WHICH CAUSES A TOTAL LOSS OF POWER INCLUDING STEERING.  AFTER COASTING TO A STOP THE CAR CAN BE IMMEDIATELY RESTARTED.  THIS OCCURS WITHOUT WARNING AND AT ANY SPEED.  NO INCREMENT WEATHER CONDITIONS WERE PRESENT.  CHANCES OF RESULTING IN A SERIOUS ACCIDENT ARE VERY HIGH.  *AK
CONSUMER  WAS TRAVELING ABOUT 45MPH AND A DEER RAN ACROSS THE ROAD. CONSUMER JAMMED THE BRAKES, AND WENT OFF THE ROAD,  SLAMMING INTO A  DITCH. UPON IMPACT,  AIRBAGS DIDN'T GO OFF.  *AK

TRAVELED FOR APPROXIMATELY 1 1/2 HOURS AT SPEEDS BETWEEN 45 - 65.  CAR LOADED WITH EQUIPMENT AND PASSENGERS.  TRAVELING UP MOUNTAIN.  CAR LOST COMPRESSION, WHITE "SMOKE" BEGAN COMING OUT FROM HOOD.  PULLED TO SIDE OF ROAD.  POPPED HOOD.  SMOKE APPEARED TO BE COMING FROM BACK OF ENGINE.  ALLOWED CAR TO REST FOR 15-20 MINUTES.  DID NOT PROCEED UP MOUNTAIN AS WE WERE ONLY 1/2 WAY UP THE MOUNTAIN.  TURNED AROUND TO HEAD HOME.  CAR RAN FINE GOING HOME.  MECHANIC THOROUGHLY CHECKED OUT VEHICLE WITH DIAGNOSTIC AND VISUAL CHECK.  COULD FIND NOTHING WRONG ALTHOUGH THE CAR DIED ON HIM ON A SHORT DISTANCE RUN _3-8 MILES.  AFTER ALLOWING CAR TO REST, IT STARTED UP FINE.  THIS YEAR VEHICLE HAS REQUIRED A 5-10 MINUTE WARMING UP PERIOD BEFORE DRIVING IN COLD WEATHER.  HAS BEGUN CHOKING AND STALLING ON SHORT DISTANCE TRIPS.  MECHANIC INSPECTED CATALYTIC CONVERTER.  CHECKED FINE ON DIAGNOSTIC AND VISUAL INSPECTION.  *AK

TRAVELLED OPEN ROAD FOR TWO HOURS.  TRAVELING UP A MOUNTAIN WITH CAR LOADED FOR CAMPING, AND 3 PASSENGERS.  CAR LOST COMPRESSION AND WHITE "SMOKE" NOT STEAM WAS POURING FROM UNDERNEATH HOOD.  PULLED TO SIDE OF THE ROAD, TURNED OFF CAR AND POPPED HOOD.  SMOKE WAS COMING FROM THE BLACK BOX ON TOP OF THE ENGINE COMPARTMENT.  WAITED 15-20 MINUTES FOR SMOKE TO EVAPORATE.  STARTED CAR AND CONTINUED 10 - 20 MINUTES TO DESTINATION.  NO FURTHER MISHAPS. *AK

TRAVELLING ON INTERSTATE 66 - FOR APPROXIMATELY 1/2 HOUR TO 45 MINUTES.....AT NIGHT.....INSTRUMENT PANEL LIGHTS ALL ON AND ENGINE LOST COMPRESSION....ABLE TO PULL TO SIDE OF THE ROAD......CHECKED OIL....FINE.....WAITED 15-20 MINUTES.  CAR STARTED UP AND RAN FINE REST OF TRIP HOME ABOUT 2 HOURS.

VEHICLE EXPERIENCED BRAKE FAILURE WHILE APPLYING BRAKES. WHEN COMING TO A SLOW STOP ON  WET / ICY ROAD CONDITIONS, VEHICLE  REAR ENDED  ANOTHER VEHICLE IN FRONT. DEALER NOTIFIED, AND INFORMED CONSUMER THAT NOTHING COULD BE FOUND.  *AK

AFTER APPROX. 2 MINUTES AFTER ENGINE START AND AT APPROX. 20MPH, ENGINE RPM'S SUDDENLY AND RAPIDILY ACCELERATED TO 5000 RPM'S. ENGINE DID NOT RETURN TO NORMAL UNTIL ENGINE SHUT OFF AND RESTARTED.  COULD NOT STOP CAR EVEN WITH BOTH FEET APPLYING  BRAKES.  HAD TO JAM TRANSMISSION INTO PARK TO STOP CAR..
AFTER COLD ENGINE START,  APPROX. 2 MINUTES OF DRIVING, AT APPROX. 20 MPH ENGINE RPM'S VERY SUDDENLY AND RAPIDLY WENT TO 5000RPMS UNCONTROLLED.  DID NOT RETURN TO IDLE UNTIL ENGINE SHUT OFF. *AK
THIS CAR HAS BEEN METICULOUSLY CARED FOR; WE HAVE FULL RECORDS. THIS SHOULD OCCUR AT THIS MILEAGE.
BOTH OF THE MOTORIZED SEATBELTS FAILED. I KNOW SEVERAL PEOPLE WITH THIS TYPE OF CAR AND EVERYONE OF THEM HAVE HAD THE SAME FAILURE. THE REPAIR IS $800. THE SEATBELTS SHOULD BE RECALLED.
VEHICLE WAS INVOLVED IN A FRONTAL COLLISION, AND THE AIRBAGS DID NOT DEPLOY.   VEHICLE WAS TOTALED.  MANUFACTURER AND DEALER HAVE BEEN NOTIFIED.  *AK

VEHICLE ENGINE HARD TO START.  CRANKS BUT DOES NOT TURN OVER UNTIL 6 OR 7 TIMES TRYING, IF THEN.  STRONG SMELL OF GAS. PROBLEM IS INTERMITTENT WHEN ENGINE IS WARM.  NO PROBLEM WHEN ENGINE IS COLD OR HOT.

AUTOMATIC SHOULDER BELT IS LOCKED INTO PLACE AND HAS TO BE MANUALLY OPENED.  MOTOR IS BROKEN AND MAY NOT PROTECT DRIVER IN CASE OF ACCIDENT. DEALER  IS NOT AWARE OF THE PROBLEM. PROBLEM STILL EXISTS, WARRANTY OR INSURANCE WILL NOT COVER.   *AK

THE MOTORIZED SHOULDER HARNESS RETRACTOR OPERATES ERRATICALLY, FREQUENTLY LEAVING THE HARNESS ONLY PARTIALLY RETRACTED.  WE ARE CONCERNED ABOUT SAFE OPERATION OF THE VEHICLE BECAUSE OF INTERFERENCE WITH STEERING, TURN SIGNAL OPERATION AND VISIBILITY (INCLUDING VISIBILITY IN LEFT REAR VIEW MIRROR).  THERE IS ALSO CONCERN ABOUT STRANGULATION IN THE EVENT OF A CRASH BECAUSE OF THE POSITION OF THE BELT WELL FORSARD OF THE BODY, AND BELOW THE LEVEL OF THE NECK.  MY WIFE CONSISTENTLY DISCONNECTS THE BELT, LEAVING ONLY THE LAP BELT, BUT THIS CERTAINLY DOESN'T PROVIDE OPTIMAL SAFETY EITHER, PARTICULARLY BECAUSE THE VEHICLE IS EQUIPPED WITH AN AIR BAG.  THE DEALER HAS ESTIMATED REPAIR COSTS AT OVER $500.00.  WE FEEL BECAUSE IT IS REQUIRED SAFETY EQUIPMENT, THEY SHOULD REPAIR IT AT THEIR EXPENSE. THANKS FOR YOUR HELP.  *AK

VEHICLE EXPERIENCED SUDDEN ACCELERATION WHEN PULLING INTO CAR WASH RESULTING IN VEHICLE HITTING POLE, WHEN DRIVER PUT CAR INTO REVERSE THE CAR ACCELERATED AGAIN HITTING ANOTHER POLE BEHIND THE CAR, RESULTING IN INJURY TO CONSUMER. MJS

summary: VEHICLE BROUGHT IN FOR SERVICE TWO SEPARATE TIMES FOR THE SAME PROBLEM AT 43,000 MILES, FOR SUSPECTED TRANSMISSION PROBLEMS.  WAS TOLD THAT THE OIL PUMP, TIMING BELT, AND IDLE CONTROL VALVE WERE DEFECTIVE AND NEEDED REPLACEMENT UNDER WARRANTY.  AT 60,000 MILES THE CAR WAS SERVICED FOR REGULAR MAINTENANCE, AND TOLD TO CHECK THE TRANSMISSION, AS IT WAS STILL NOT FUNCTIONING CORRECTLY.  FOUR THOUSAND MILES LATER, AT 64,000 MILES, THE TRANSMISSION SEIZED WHILE DRIVING WITH TWO SMALL CHILDREN AND ONE PASSENGER.  THE DEALER REFUSES TO PAY FOR REPAIR AT THIS TIME.  RETRIEVED INFORMATION REGARDING THE RECALL ON 1993 LEGACY TRANSMISSIONS, CONCERNED THAT I NEVER RECEIVED THE RECALL INFORMATION, NOR WAS TOLD BY ANY OF THE LAST THREE DEALERS THAT I HAVE DELT WITH ABOUT THIS POTENTIAL LIFE-THREATENING DEFECT!
